p: Summing up, the data reflect the high potency of T. decussatus EOs, which could be attributed to its content of terpenoid compounds, particularly the monoterpenes, such as the major compounds carvacrol and p-cymene. It is worth mentioning that p-cymene is represented as the major phytotoxic compound of many plants, such as Origanum acutidens [ 49], Zataria multiflora [ 50], Eucalyptus citriodora, Eucalyptus grandis [ 51], Thymbra spicata [ 52], Thymus eigii [ 53], and Thymus daenensis [ 54].
